description: Smallest positive a(n) such that number of solutions to a(n)=a(j)+a(k) j<k<n is two or less.
example: 12 is in the sequence since it is 4+8 and 2+10 but no other sum of two distinct terms.
mathematica: f[s_List, j_Integer] := Block[{cnt, k = s[[-1]] + 1, ss = Plus @@@ Subsets[s, {j}]}, While[ cnt = Count[ss, k]; cnt == 0 || cnt > 2, k++]; Append[s, k]]; Nest[f[#, 2] &, {1, 2}, 70] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 05 2014 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 15 2001
